response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name". I want to get the value of this key. I tried using JSONObject.get("name") but it doesn't work. I also tried using JSONObject.get("name").toString() but it doesn't work either. I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You're trying to get the value of a key that doesn't exist.
